qas.question: What must all travellers have when arriving in rwanda?

answers.text: All travelers arriving in Rwanda must have a negative COVID-19 certificate

qas.question: What is the only accepted test?

answers.text: The only accepted test is a SARS-CoV 2 Real Time Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR)

qas.question: When must the accepted test be performed?

answers.text: performed within 72 hours prior to departure

paragraphs.context: All travelers arriving in Rwanda must have a negative COVID-19 certificate. The only accepted test is a SARS-CoV 2 Real Time Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR) performed within 72 hours prior to departure (meaning travelers must be tested and get results within 3 days of their first flight). Other tests, such as Rapid Diagnostics Tests (RDTs), are not accepted.

qas.question: Are covid-19 tests mandatory for children under 5 years of age?

answers.text: COVID-19 tests are not mandatory for accompanied children under 5 years

qas.question: What test should eligible travellers take?
What age bracket counts as an incoming eligible traveller?

answers.text: Incoming travelers eligible (aged 12 years and above)

paragraphs.context: COVID-19 tests are not mandatory for accompanied children under 5 years. Incoming travelers eligible (aged 12 years and above). You should arrange to take a private test.
